message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.SI. 

This paper is about using graph convolutional networks for text classification, which is a problem in natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves machine learning techniques, such as neural networks, which are commonly studied in cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper involves learning embeddings for words and documents, which is a common topic in cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also involves information retrieval techniques, such as building a text graph based on word co-occurrence and document word relations, which is a topic in cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the paper discusses the robustness of the proposed method to less training data, which is a topic in cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
